breadcrumb.title: UCSF Art & Architecture at Mission Bay: Changing the Landscape

node.title: UCSF Art & Architecture at Mission Bay: Changing the Landscape

excerpt.short: Along the shores of San Francisco Bay, just south of AT&T Park, a long-underused swath of land began to realize a potential greater than anything the city could have imagined when, in 2003, UCSF opened Genentech Hall, the first building on its Mission Bay campus, San Francisco.
The moon rises over the construction site for the UCSF Medical Center scheduled to open in 2015 as San Francisco’s first new hospital in 30 years.

Along the shores of San Francisco Bay, just south of AT&T Park, a long-underused swath of land began to realize a potential greater than anything the city could have imagined when, in 2003, UCSF opened Genentech Hall, the first building on its Mission Bay campus, San Francisco.
